occurrences.text: don't have faith to exercise in our God being able to do something. You know what God says in Malachi? I understand it's with regard to giving and how they had robbed God of the tithe, but He says, prove me, prove me and see if I won't do this. You know, there are times in our lives that God says, prove me, prove me. A couple of examples. The one that I just mentioned with Elijah, praying and God sending fire from heaven. How bold would you have been, how bold would I have been in the midst of that great company to pray that prayer? Believing that God could do it? That God would do it? I preached a message on Tuesday at the AIBF meeting to the pastors that were there. And as I preached that message, I used a portion of Scripture and I spoke about Moses. And when Moses was instructed in Exodus 17, they got to the place where there's no water. And God says, here's what I want you to do after he prayed and God answers and He says, I want you to go out this way and I'm going to go before you and I'm going to show you the rock and I want you to strike the rock. But He tells them this, to take the elders and do it in front of the people.
